data.title: Summit County, CO
images: https://www.summitcountyco.gov/services/transit_summit_stage/Images/Services/Transit Summit Stage/Employment Opportunities/Summit Stage STARTING WAGE.png
data.text:
Transit / Summit Stage

Free public transit service within Summit County, Colorado.

The Summit Stage provides access to public lands, lodging, town centers, retail areas, and medical centers. It also operates two commuter routes, connecting with both Park County and Lake County. Summit Stage provides ADA paratransit service.

Use our SmartBus App from your phone for easy access to schedules.

Employment Opportunities

Bus Operators

Applications for bus driver positions are accepted on an on-going basis. Applicants must be at least 21 years old and possess a Colorado Commercial Driver's License (CDL) or be able to obtain one through our driver training program within two weeks of starting. Bus Operator pay starts at $30.25 per hour plus an excellent Summit County Government benefits package and a $5,000 Retention Bonus paid out over the first year.

LEARN MORE

Bike Racks

All Summit Stage buses are equipped with bike racks from May 1 through Oct. 31, for use between sunrise and sunset. Bike racks can accommodate up to 3 bikes max, on a first-come first served basis. No bikes are allowed inside of the bus. No Bikes are allowed on racks bus before sunrise or after sunset. Official times for sunrise/sunset are obtained through Google search, using Frisco, CO as the location. Learn how to use Summit Stage bike racks.

Summit Stage buses do not have bike racks equipped Nov 1st - April 31st.

Find Your Bus

View Summit Stage routes and real-time bus locations with a smartphone using our Summit Stage App or the Summit Stage SmartBus system.

Advertise on Summit Stage Buses

To advertise your business on our buses, contact Street Media Group.
